text:
Chin Seng Popiah – A Tasty and Affordable Popiah Spot (4/5 Stars)

Rating:

• Atmosphere: 4/5 (Clean and tidy stall with a casual atmosphere)
• Food Quality: 4/5 (Delicious and well-prepared popiah with a perfect balance of flavors and textures)
• Service: 4/5 (Friendly and efficient service)
• Value: 4.5/5 (Affordable prices for the quality and quantity of food)

Overall: 4/5

Donkey and I were craving something delicious after dinner, so we decided to check out Chin Seng Popiah. It’s a small stall run by a friendly Chinese lady (who might be Vietnamese) who greeted us with a warm smile.

The stall is located in the middle of a coffee shop, with a clean and tidy setup. The atmosphere was casual, and there wasn’t much of a crowd when we visited. Despite its small size, the stall offers a diverse menu, including popiah, rojak, traditional and crispy pancakes, and Mui Chee, making it a good option for those looking for variety.

Donkey and I ordered two popiah, one with chili and one without. The popiah was a delightful surprise. The thin skin was perfectly crispy and held together beautifully. The warm turnip filling was sweet, slightly spicy, and packed with a satisfying crunch from the vegetables. The chili sauce added a nice kick without being overpowering, making it the perfect complement to the savory filling. It was some of the best popiah we’ve had in a while.

The lady running the stall was friendly and efficient, making the ordering process smooth.

Donkey and I were happy with our experience at Chin Seng Popiah. The popiah was delicious, the stall was welcoming, and the prices were affordable. We definitely recommend checking it out if you’re looking for a tasty snack. You won’t be disappointed.

Kitty and I were craving something delicious after dinner, so we decided to check out Chin Seng Popiah. It’s a small store, run by a friendly Chinese lady, (I think she might be Vietnamese) who greeted us with a warm smile. They offer a diverse menu, including popiah, rojak, traditional and crispy pancakes, and Mui Chee. While the popiah is the star, the other dishes offer variety for those seeking a broader culinary experience.

We decided to order two popiah, one with chili and one without. The popiah itself was a delightful surprise. The thin skin was perfectly crispy and held together beautifully. The warm turnip filling was a real treat, it was sweet, slightly spicy, and packed with a satisfying crunch from the vegetables. The chili sauce added a nice kick without being overpowering, making it the perfect complement to the savory filling. It was some of the good popiah we've had in a while.

The atmosphere of the stall was clean and tidy. It’s just a small store with a small corner in the middle of the coffee shop. The setting was casual, and there wasn’t much of a crowd. When we ordered, the lady staff was friendly and efficient.

Overall, we were happy with our experience with Chin Seng Popiah. The popiah was nice, the atmosphere was welcoming. We definitely recommend checking it out if you're looking for a tasty and affordable snack. You won't be disappointed.
the food there are very delicious ⭐️
Ok lah the snacks are fine but the stall owner attitude needs improvement.
